xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager
Class RecordManager.PageInformation

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager.RecordManager.PageInformation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Enclosing class:
RecordManager
public class RecordManager.PageInformation
extends Object
implements Serializable

Does not make I/Os! Only utility methods for the RecordManager. Size: 14 bytes plus references of two arrays.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

RecordManager.PageInformation

public RecordManager.PageInformation()
Constructs a new PageInformation object.

Method Detail

checkConsistency

public void checkConsistency(Object pageId,
                             Page p,
                             boolean fullCheck)
Checks the consistency between the Page and the PageInformation objects.

Parameters:
pageId - Identifyer of the page which is tested for consistency.
p - Page object to be checked against "this" object.
fullCheck - determines if a full check with the number of link records is done. This is rather time consuming.

writeReservedRecordNumbersIntoPage

public void writeReservedRecordNumbersIntoPage(Page p)
Writes the already reserved record numbers into the specified page (should be the page which belongs to this object). The caller is responsible for storing the page. All the reserved record numbers inside this object are deleted.

Parameters:
p - Page into which the corresponding reservations are written.

isReservationPossible

public boolean isReservationPossible()
Determines if there is space for a new reservation.

Returns:
true iff a reservation is possible.

updateReserveInformation

public void updateReserveInformation(TId tid,
                                     short numberOfRecordsAdded,
                                     int numberOfBytesUsedByRecordsAdded,
                                     short numberOfLinkRecordsAdded)
If a reservation/insert/update is made directly on the Page object, then this reservation has to be send to the PageInformation object to update its internal structures (number of records, length of all records, min/max record numbers). Also, the strategy is informed about the update.

Parameters:
tid - record which is updated.
numberOfRecordsAdded - has to be -1, 0 or +1.
numberOfBytesUsedByRecordsAdded - can be positive, 0 or negative.
numberOfLinkRecordsAdded - has to be -1, 0 or +1.

bytesFreeAfterPossibleReservation

public int bytesFreeAfterPossibleReservation(int numberOfBytes)
Returns the number of bytes that would be free inside the current Page after a reservation of a certain number of bytes.

Parameters:
numberOfBytes - number of bytes for the reservation.
Returns:
the hypothetic number of bytes free after such a reservation. If <0 the reservation is not possible.

bytesFreeAfterPossibleReservation

public int bytesFreeAfterPossibleReservation(int numOfRecords,
                                             int numOfLinkRecords,
                                             int numOfBytesUsedByRecords,
                                             int numOfBytes)
Returns the number of bytes that would be free inside the current Page after a reservation of a certain number of bytes.

Parameters:
numOfRecords - Number of records before the reservation.
numOfLinkRecords - Number of link records before the reservation.
numOfBytesUsedByRecords - Number of bytes used inside the record before the reservation.
numOfBytes - number of bytes for the reservation.
Returns:
the hypothetic number of bytes free after such a reservation. If <0 the reservation is not possible.

getNewReservedRecordNr

public short getNewReservedRecordNr(Block record)
Tries to get a new recordNr without reading the page. If successful (return value>=0). It does not update the structures inside the PageInformation object which are modified using the updateReserveInformation. So, you have to call it yourself.

Parameters:
record - Record for which a number is wanted.
Returns:
-1 if no id can be given directly. Then you have to call writeReservedIdsIntoPage and use the methods of the Page itself.

toString

public String toString()
Outputs some statistical data for the PageInformation.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
String representation of important facts of this Object.
